Event.0: American director Kathryn Bigelow became the first woman to win an Academy Award for best director, for The Hurt Locker (2008).
Event.1: Despite only being 17 years old, Brazilian soccer star Neymar makes his professional debut for Santos
Event.2: Former vocalist of "Babado Novo" Claudia Leitte (26) weds Marcio Pedreira at Hotel Convento do Carmo in Salvador, Brazil
Event.3: American director and writer Stanley Kubrick—whose iconic films are characterized by a cool, formal visual style, meticulous attention to detail, and a detached, often ironic pessimism—died in England.
Event.4: American boxer Mike Tyson became the youngest heavyweight to acquire the World Boxing Association (WBA) championship belt when he defeated James Smith in 12 rounds.
Event.5: Actor Johhny Depp and Lori Depp divorce after 2 years of marriage
Event.6: "Mirror", Russian film directed by Andrei Tarkovsky, starring Margarita Terekhova and Ignat Daniltsev, is released
Event.7:
Attack on civil rights protesters in Selma, Alabama
On this day in 1965, state troopers used nightsticks and tear gas to attack American civil rights activists as they crossed a bridge in Selma, Alabama, during their march to the state capitol in Montgomery.
Event.8:
Rik Mayall
British actor and comedian
was born
Event.9:
Bryan Cranston
American actor
was born
Event.10: West Indian cricketer Viv Richards, who earned the nickname “Master Blaster” as arguably the finest batsman of his generation, was born in Antigua.
Event.11:
Michael Eisner
American executive
was born
Event.12: Comedian Oliver Hardy (48) marries film assistant Virginia Lucille Jones (30)
Event.13: Hitler breaks Treaty of Versailles by sending troops to the Rhineland
Event.14: 1st jazz record released on a 78 by Original Dixieland Jass Band for the Victor Talking Machine Company ("Dixie Jazz Band One Step," one side "Livery Stable Blues" other)
Event.15: Roald Amundsen announces discovery of the South Pole
Event.16:
Reinhard Heydrich
German Nazi official
was born
Event.17: Alexander Graham Bell receives a patent for the telephone in the US
Event.18: Alexander Graham Bell received a patent for the telephone.
Event.19:
Maurice Ravel
French composer
was born
Event.20: Composer Maurice Ravel was born in Ciboure, France.
Event.21: Painter Piet Mondrian—who was an important leader in the development of modern abstract art, known for works that possess a formal purity that embodies his spiritual belief in a harmonious cosmos—was born in Amersfoort, Netherlands.
Event.22: U.S. Senator Daniel Webster spoke out in favour of the Compromise of 1850 (enacted in September), a series of moderate measures that addressed the question of slavery in U.S. territories.
Event.23: English astronomer Sir John Herschel, a successor to his father, Sir William Herschel, in the field of stellar and nebular observation and discovery, was born.
Event.24: Massachusetts established the first bicameral legislature in North America.
Event.25: Marcus Aurelius became emperor of Rome.
Event.26: Roman Emperor Antoninus Pius dies and is succeeded by co-Emperors Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus, an unprecedented political arrangement in the Roman Empire
Event.27: English King Henry VIII's divorce request is denied by the Pope.
